peep.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to look at something quickly and secretly, especially through a hole or opening
peep.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The door was ajar and Helen peeped in.
Henry peeped through the window into the kitchen.
peep.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: if something peeps from somewhere, you can just see a small amount of it
peep.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: I could see her toes peeping out from under the sheet.
peep.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to look at something because it is interesting or attractive
peep.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: On our website you can peep our video interview with R&B’s newest supergroup.
peep.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a quick or secret look at something
peep.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Jon took a peep at his watch.
peep.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: a short high sound, like the sound a mouse or a young bird makes
peep.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: loud peeps from the smoke alarm
peep.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: a word meaning ‘people’, used in magazines
